page.title: 09INDUSTRY in WESTMILL
page.content: The Company applied for planning permission to dig the quarry. It was granted and they bought the land freehold from Downfield Farm. Then they purchased a washing and grading plant which was erected on the site.Boreholes were sunk through to the chalk which lies under the gravel to obtain water. In all the plant uses 20,000 gallons of water a minute from the boreholes and the River Rib, which is recycled. Dragline and hydraulic excavators dig out the sand and gravel which is now transported to the washing and grading plant by 20ton dumper trucks. Previously conveyor belts did the job. Eleven men work on production and six more on the lorries. There is a manager and one or two office staff. Training is given to young men. Work conditions and safety have improved over the years.
